person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Law Enforcement Tools For More Effective Prosecution (LET 4 MEP)

description.narrative: LWOB will deliver TIP training to Liberian judges, lawyers, magistrates, and law enforcement personnel. It will produce and distribute illustrated graphic novels designed to convey complex legal concepts to potential victims of trafficking and to members of the legal community that are tailored to a Liberian context. These will be accompanied by trainer manuals that guide trainers through two (2) previously distributed graphic novels on the subject of TIPS and two newly created graphic novels under this grant. Law enforcement personnel will be provided with law enforcement "toolkits" that will provide law enforcement with critical practice tools in clear-cut and durable materials. The trainings are designed to promote the rule of law and will strengthen Liberia's overall capacity to identify, investigate, and successfully prosecute trafficking in persons cases. The trainings will be dual purposed to enable Liberians to practice in a non-TIPS context those skills that will be necessary to try a TIPS case, when it does present itself to prosecutors and the court. Focus will be on the discernible areas where stakeholders are misconstruing what are clearly human trafficking crimes and failing to prosecute (or successfully prosecute) TIPS scenarios under Liberia's 2005 Act to Ban Trafficking in Persons.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Preservation of Providence Island, the Birthplace of Modern Liberia, Phase 2

description.narrative: Situated in the center of the capital city of Monrovia, Providence Island is the birthplace of the modern nation of Liberia. Very little of the original early 19th-century settlement survives on the island, which is itself vulnerable to urban encroachment and other threats. This project continues work begun under a previous Ambassadors Fund grant and involves landscape restoration, a shoreline erosion study, and a field archaeology program for Liberian and American students.

title.narrative: Department of State - Peacekeeping Operations: Support to the Armed Forces of Liberia

description.narrative: To support transformation of the Armed Forces of Liberia (AFL) to a professional, apolitical force. Funding supported the following activities: refurbishment of Camp Edward B. Kesselly (62 buildings and facilities); operations and maintenance of the camps; security; military trainers; program management; specialized training for military occupational specialists; specialized training for the AFL brigade training unit; and procurement of AFL equipment (communications, vehicles, medical supplies, unit equipment, weapons, tentage, general supplies, maintenance equipment, and unit equipment). Funds also supported travel and per diem costs of U.S. military mentors in Liberia to support the new AFL.

title.narrative: Enhancing TIP Victim Services Program: Liberia

description.narrative: WHI is supporting the establishment and institutionalization of a national referral mechanism in Liberia through educational roundtables that bring together key officials to develop and promote standard operating procedures for victim identification and referral. Additionally, WHI is enhancing victim protection efforts in Liberia by providing short-term emergency shelter and holistic case management and reintegration assistance for up to 50 victims of trafficking, and developing a national anti-trafficking hotline.

title.narrative: Preservation of Providence Island, the Birthplace of Modern Liberia

description.narrative: Situated in the center of the capital city of Monrovia, Providence Island is the birthplace of the modern nation of Liberia. Very little of the original early 19th-century settlement survives on the island, which is itself vulnerable to urban encroachment and other threats. This project involves a survey of the island and the development of a conservation plan to preserve the site for cultural and educational uses.
